dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Oh... excuse me! Sorry... Do you speak English? I’m completely lost... I was trying to find the train station...

choices.text: Yes! I speak English. What's the problem?
Pretend you don’t hear and walk away.
Say 'Yes' but actually don't understand anything.
Explain how to go but don’t go with him.
Laugh, apologize and say you can’t help.

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Oh... uhm... okay... bye... (He walks away, still lost...)

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Yes! Train! I need train station... where... where it is?

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Oh! Thank goodness! Finally someone! Yes... I'm trying to get to the train station before 5pm. Could you help me?

choices.text: Hmm... I'm not sure... good luck!

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Oh... Okay. Thanks... anyway... (walks away disappointed).

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Uhm... oh... okay...? Thank you...? (walks in the wrong direction... completely confused...)

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: ... Oh... okay. I guess... never mind... (watches you walk away).

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Oh... yes? Oh no... I... I don’t understand... You... understand me? Hello? Hello?!

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Thank you! You’re a lifesaver! (Follows you until you reach the train station.)

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Oh... Okay. Go straight, then left? Hmm... I’ll try! Thank you! Thank you so much!

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Haha... Oh... okay. No worries. I’ll try someone else. Bye!

dialogue.speaker: Gringo
dialogue.text: Thank you! Thank you so much! You’re the best! Have a great day, my friend!
